name: basswood
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a large deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) with leaves that are heart-shaped and pale yellow flowers: The forest featured a mixture of basswood, maple, and oak trees. Basswoods can grow up to 40 metres in height.
[ U ] the white wood of the basswood tree: If you want to take up wood carving, choose blocks of basswood as they are easy to use for a beginner. The body of the guitar is made from basswood, a light and strong material.
More examplesFewer examplesA stand of basswoods was planted to provide shade.They walked down an impressive avenue planted with basswood trees.Basswood has a close grain with no knots.
